page.title: 02BLUE STONE HEATH & BAIN VAL.
page.content: The landforms of the area are seen as the result of glacial & post glacial erosion. Lower chalk stratas and the under- lying Carstone can be seen at various places along the hill-ridge traversing the North of the area.The South-facing field slopes show all the sub-soil types,from the chalk ridge, through the Tealby clay and sandstone, down to the sand and river gravels of the old river valley. Deep{Coombs}are found at intervals along this line of hills,caused by the ponding-back of glacial melt-water from the still-frozen North Sea as the glacial period ended. { Spring lines}appear along both faces of the valley where water percolating through the chalk, surfaces.{Red Hill (Nature reserve) shows the Cretaceous to Jurassic sequence(Kimmeridge clay).
